gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਸਰਿਤਾ ਜਲੁ ਕਾਸਟਹਿ ਨ ਬੋਰਤ ਕਰਤ ਚਿਤ ਲਾਜ ਅਪਨੋੲੀ ਪ੍ਰਤਿਪਾਰਿਓ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Saritaa Jalu Kaasatahi N Borata , Karat Chit Laaj Apanoee Pratipaariao Hai ?
translation: Just as the water of streams and rivers does not sink the wood, it (water) has the shame of the fact that it has irrigated and brought the wood up;

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਕਰਤ ਸੁਤ ਅਨਿਕ ੲਿਅਾਨ ਪਨ ਤੳੂ ਨ ਜਨਨੀ ਅਵਗੁਨ ੳੁਰਧਾਰਿਓ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Karat Sout Anik Iaan Pana , Taoo N Jananee Avagoun Uradhaariao Hai ?
translation: Just as a son commits many mistakes but his mother who has given him birth never recounts them (she still keeps loving him).

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਸਰੰਨ ਸੂਰ ਪੂਰਨ ਪਰਤਗਿਅਾ ਰਾਖੈ ਲਖ ਅਪਰਾਧ ਕੀੲੇ ਮਾਰਿ ਨ ਬਿਡਾਰਿਓ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Sarann Soor Pooran Paratagiaa Raakhai , Lakh Aparaadh Keeay Maari N Bidaariao Hai ?
translation: Just as a culprit who may have myriad vices is not killed by a brave warrior in whose refuge he may have come, the warrior protects him and thus fulfils his virtuous traits.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਹੀ ਪਰਮ ਗੁਰ ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰਸ ਗਤਿ ਸਿਖਨ ਕੋ ਕਿਰਤ ਕਰਮੁ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਬੀਚਾਰਿਓ ਹੈ ||੫੩੬||
transliteration: Taisay Hee Param Gur Paaras Paras Gati , Sikhan Ko Kirat Karamu Kachhoo N Beechaariao Hai ?536?
translation: Similarly the supreme benevolent True Guru does not dwell on any of the faults of His Sikhs. He is like touch of philosopher-stone (True Guru removes dross of the Sikhs in His refuge and makes them gold-like precious and pure).   (536)
